featured.text: Many folk tales are also tall tales—stories of unbelievable events told with perfect seriousness.
She did not think that plastic stools were tall enough for her.
The Cambodian tea tree grows five meters tall.
As the tallest building in the world, Taipei 101 has become a new ______ of Taipei City.
The trees were taller and stronger.

other.text: Mounted in the two tall towers of the cathedral, Notre-Dame’s bells have been ringing for over 800 years.
A tall tale, in other words, is a story in which the truth has been exaggerated.
It is about 37 m tall, 20 it one of the tallest log structures in the world.
What is “the Seine” mentioned in the passage? (A) A tall monument.
Performers usually play on a tall stage with lanterns and banners strung all around.
For 20 minutes, we walked along a path past tall weeds, banana trees, and low brush.
Which of the following statements about tall tales is NOT TRUE? (A) Tall tales are factual stories.
Our destination was a 150-foot tall capirana tree, by far the biggest tree around.

definition.zh_def: 高的，指身高或物體的高度。
definition.en_def: Having a greater than average height.
definition.example: She is taller than her brother.
